N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 640.1 - Scope

State Regulations

Tax Law, §§ 253, 257

The mortgage recording taxes are taxes imposed on the
recording of a mortgage on real property situated in New York State. The taxes
are paid to the recording officer of any county in which the real property or
any part thereof is situated, at the time the mortgage is recorded, or in the
case of certain corporate trust mortgages at or before the time a further
amount is to be advanced, accrues or becomes secured. Notes
